definition: The theft of 13 pieces of art from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston, Massachusetts, which occurred on March 18, 1990.
Considered one of the largest property thefts in history with an estimated loss of $500 million.
The stolen works include pieces by Vermeer, Rembrandt, and Manet, none of which have been recovered.

The name 'Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum' originates from Isabella Stewart Gardner, an American art collector who established the museum in 1903.
history: First appearing in public discourse after the robbery on March 18, 1990.
The incident is notable for its sophisticated execution, carried out by two men posing as police officers.
Unsolved to this day, the heist remains a significant unsolved art theft in the history of art crime.
